content: The "Taxpayer Choice Act of 2007" repeals the alternative minimum tax for noncorporate taxpayers. The "Taxpayer Choice Act of 2007" repeals the alternative minimum tax for noncorporate taxpayers. Section 55(a) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to eliminate the tax for taxable years after December 31, 2006, and set the tentative minimum tax to zero for noncorporate taxpayers. Conforming amendments are made to related sections of the Code. The amendments made by the "Taxpayer Choice Act of 2007" set the tentative minimum tax to zero for noncorporate taxpayers starting from taxable years after December 31, 2006. SEC. 3. SIMPLIFIED INDIVIDUAL INCOME TAX SYSTEM. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to introduce a simplified individual income tax system. The taxpayer can elect to be subject to a different tax under this section instead of section 1 for a taxable year and subsequent years. If the election is made, the tax under this section is treated as the tax under section 1 for that year. The taxpayer can elect to be subject to a different tax under this section instead of section 1 for a taxable year and subsequent years. The election, once made, is irrevocable. The taxpayer can make an irrevocable election to be subject to a different tax under this section for a taxable year and subsequent years. A taxpayer may revoke this election for a taxable year and all subsequent years, except if a prior revocation has been made. In cases of major life events, a taxpayer can make or revoke an election under paragraph (1) for the applicable taxable year and all subsequent years. The taxpayer can make an irrevocable election for a different tax under this section for a taxable year and subsequent years, with major life events like marriage, divorce, and death triggering the option. Married individuals and surviving spouses under this election face an imposed tax. A tax is imposed on the alternative taxable income of individuals based on a specific table. The tax on alternative taxable income for unmarried individuals is based on a specific table, with rates varying based on income levels. The tax on net capital gain of noncorporate taxpayers is capped at the sum of the tax on modified taxable income and the adjusted net capital gain. The tax on net capital gain for noncorporate taxpayers is capped at the sum of the tax on modified taxable income and adjusted net capital gain. Alternative taxable income is defined as gross income minus certain deductions. The tax code outlines deductions for gross income, including personal exemption, dependent allowance, and alternative standard deduction. Personal exemption varies based on filing status, while the dependent allowance is a set amount. The tax code provides deductions for gross income, including personal exemption, dependent allowance, and alternative standard deduction. The dependent allowance is $3,500 per dependent, and the alternative standard deduction ranges from $12,500 to $25,000 based on filing status. Inflation adjustments apply to dollar amounts for rate brackets after 2007. The tax code provisions for inflation adjustments to dollar amounts in rate brackets and deductions. Amounts in subsections (b) and (d)(2)(B), (d)(3), and (d)(4) are increased based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the taxable year. Rounding rules apply if the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $100. A conforming amendment is made to the table of sections in the tax code. Sec. 5. Simplified Individual Income Tax System. Sec. 6. Cross references relating to tax on individuals. Capital Gains and Dividends Rate Made Permanent. Effective Date: Amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006.
